title: Clattercote Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Clattercote Reservoir by Ian Rob, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Clattercote Reservoir in autumn

description: This small reservoir is located just south of Claydon in Oxfordshire. It's primarily used for fishing but there's also a nice circular boardwalk trail around the lake. As such it's a bit of a hidden gem and a nice peaceful place for an easy Sunday afternoon stroll. There's a car park at the eastern end of the reservoir, just off Mollington Road where you can start the walk. You can continue your waterside walking by heading east from Claydon to pick up the Oxford Canal Walk .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the north east there's more nice waterside walking and fishing to be found at Boddington Reservoir. Just to the north west there's the pretty village of Avon Dassett, the National Trust's Farnborough Hall, the Tysoe Windmill, Burton Dassett Hills Country Park and Edge Hill, site of the famous civil war battle of 1642.

display_address: Mollington Road, Clattercote, Claydon with Clattercot, Claydon, Cherwell, Oxfordshire, England, OX17 1QE, United Kingdom
